page.title: 01Mid Norfolk Hunting Country
page.content: This is a rural area of slightly undulating country with several small old-established, mostly deciduous woods. The land is mainly used for arable farming, but with expanding gravel working in the north-west. Population is small and largely concentrated in longham village. After years of decline the population is growing slowly as people move in from other regions. Bittering village comrises 4 inhabited and one empty house, a medieval church, the archaelogical site of the medieval village (Bitteringa) & the site of the recently demolished Bittering Hall, once the home of William Wilberforce, the anti-slavery campaigner. Longham boasts a public house, village store/post office, & a social club. Most of the working population are employed outside the area. Fox
